page.title: 07continuation of page 6
page.content: in the numbers of good gardening books. Usually, however, when they visit the Garden Centre they are in search of information about the plants and shrubs. Questioned outside the Centre, particularly the customers in the over 40's age group confirmed that gardening is, indeed their main hobby. On average the local families visit the Garden Centre at least three times each year although some families visit to purchase plants as often as six times in the Spring and early Summer. Most of the gardening is undertaken by the husband but many of the men agreed that their wives were more likely to undertake the weeding and to generally keep the garden tidy. Although most of the men preferred growing vegetables their wives liked to grow flowers and shrubs.
